poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: This boot-sucking bog mocks whatever Moat and motte, ditch and dyke Collapse in it and cancel out. Sphagnum soaks it up, applies With a mopstick crammasy lipstick, As scratchy lichen moists its nib And sets down verse we praise but Can't decipher - not that we really need A middle ground, a ground at all. We need, I need, moss down on a moth's back And stars to read as it hoves and switches into them.
